adjectives.description: saccharoid (comparative more saccharoid, superlative most saccharoid)

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) Having a texture like granulated sugar.
(biochemistry) A polysaccharide that resembles a sugar, often insoluble and not sweet.
examples: A sweet taste is possessed by nearly all sugars, to a greater or less extent, though in some of the rarer saccharoids the character is very feebly marked.
